description: Describes a job. Requires permission to access the DescribeJob action.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

nested_items.name: documentSource
nested_items.description: An S3 link to the job document.

nested_items.name: jobArn
nested_items.description: An ARN identifying the job with format 'arn:aws:iot:region:account:job/jobId'.

nested_items.name: jobId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier you assigned to this job when it was created.

nested_items.name: targetSelection
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the job will continue to run (CONTINUOUS), or will be complete after all those things specified as targets have completed the job (SNAPSHOT). If continuous, the job may also be run on a thing when a change is detected in a target. For example, a job will run on a device when the thing representing the device is added to a target group, even after the job was completed by all things originally in the group.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the job, one of IN_PROGRESS, CANCELED, DELETION_IN_PROGRESS or COMPLETED.

nested_items.name: forceCanceled
nested_items.description: Will be true if the job was canceled with the optional force parameter set to true.

nested_items.name: reasonCode
nested_items.description: If the job was updated, provides the reason code for the update.

nested_items.name: comment
nested_items.description: If the job was updated, describes the reason for the update.

nested_items.name: targets
nested_items.description: A list of IoT things and thing groups to which the job should be sent.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A short text description of the job.

nested_items.name: presignedUrlConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration for pre-signed S3 URLs.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of an IAM role that grants permission to download files from the S3 bucket where the job data/updates are stored. The role must also grant permission for IoT to download the files.

nested_items.name: expiresInSec
nested_items.description: How long (in seconds) pre-signed URLs are valid. Valid values are 60 - 3600, the default value is 3600 seconds. Pre-signed URLs are generated when Jobs receives an MQTT request for the job document.

nested_items.name: jobExecutionsRolloutConfig
nested_items.description: Allows you to create a staged rollout of a job.

nested_items.name: maximumPerMinute
nested_items.description: The maximum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute. This parameter allows you to create a staged rollout.

nested_items.name: exponentialRate
nested_items.description: The rate of increase for a job rollout. This parameter allows you to define an exponential rate for a job rollout.

nested_items.name: baseRatePerMinute
nested_items.description: The minimum number of things that will be notified of a pending job, per minute at the start of job rollout. This parameter allows you to define the initial rate of rollout.

nested_items.name: incrementFactor
nested_items.description: The exponential factor to increase the rate of rollout for a job.

nested_items.name: rateIncreaseCriteria
nested_items.description: The criteria to initiate the increase in rate of rollout for a job.

nested_items.name: numberOfNotifiedThings
nested_items.description: The threshold for number of notified things that will initiate the increase in rate of rollout.

nested_items.name: numberOfSucceededThings
nested_items.description: The threshold for number of succeeded things that will initiate the increase in rate of rollout.

nested_items.name: abortConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration for criteria to abort the job.

nested_items.name: criteriaList
nested_items.description: The list of criteria that determine when and how to abort the job.

nested_items.name: failureType
nested_items.description: The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job abort.

nested_items.name: action
nested_items.description: The type of job action to take to initiate the job abort.

nested_items.name: thresholdPercentage
nested_items.description: The minimum percentage of job execution failures that must occur to initiate the job abort.

nested_items.name: minNumberOfExecutedThings
nested_items.description: The minimum number of things which must receive job execution notifications before the job can be aborted.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was last updated.

nested_items.name: completedAt
nested_items.description: The time, in seconds since the epoch, when the job was completed.

nested_items.name: jobProcessDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the job process.

nested_items.name: processingTargets
nested_items.description: The target devices to which the job execution is being rolled out. This value will be null after the job execution has finished rolling out to all the target devices.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: numberOfCanceledThings
nested_items.description: The number of things that cancelled the job.

nested_items.name: numberOfSucceededThings
nested_items.description: The number of things which successfully completed the job.

nested_items.name: numberOfFailedThings
nested_items.description: The number of things that failed executing the job.

nested_items.name: numberOfRejectedThings
nested_items.description: The number of things that rejected the job.

nested_items.name: numberOfQueuedThings
nested_items.description: The number of things that are awaiting execution of the job.

nested_items.name: numberOfInProgressThings
nested_items.description: The number of things currently executing the job.

nested_items.name: numberOfRemovedThings
nested_items.description: The number of things that are no longer scheduled to execute the job because they have been deleted or have been removed from the group that was a target of the job.

nested_items.name: numberOfTimedOutThings
nested_items.description: The number of things whose job execution status is TIMED_OUT.

nested_items.name: timeoutConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies the amount of time each device has to finish its execution of the job. A timer is started when the job execution status is set to IN_PROGRESS. If the job execution status is not set to another terminal state before the timer expires, it will be automatically set to TIMED_OUT.

nested_items.name: inProgressTimeoutInMinutes
nested_items.description: Specifies the amount of time, in minutes, this device has to finish execution of this job. The timeout interval can be anywhere between 1 minute and 7 days (1 to 10080 minutes). The in progress timer can't be updated and will apply to all job executions for the job. Whenever a job execution remains in the IN_PROGRESS status for longer than this interval, the job execution will fail and switch to the terminal TIMED_OUT status.

nested_items.name: namespaceId
nested_items.description: The namespace used to indicate that a job is a customer-managed job.

nested_items.name: jobTemplateArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the job template used to create the job.

nested_items.name: jobExecutionsRetryConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the criteria to retry the job.

nested_items.name: criteriaList
nested_items.description: The list of criteria that determines how many retries are allowed for each failure type for a job.

nested_items.name: failureType
nested_items.description: The type of job execution failures that can initiate a job retry.

nested_items.name: numberOfRetries
nested_items.description: The number of retries allowed for a failure type for the job.

nested_items.name: documentParameters
nested_items.description: A key-value map that pairs the patterns that need to be replaced in a managed template job document schema. You can use the description of each key as a guidance to specify the inputs during runtime when creating a job.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: isConcurrent
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a job is concurrent. Will be true when a job is rolling out new job executions or canceling previously created executions, otherwise false.

nested_items.name: schedulingConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration that allows you to schedule a job for a future date and time in addition to specifying the end behavior for each job execution.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: The time a job will begin rollout of the job document to all devices in the target group for a job. The startTime can be scheduled up to a year in advance and must be scheduled a minimum of thirty minutes from the current time. The date and time format for the startTime is YYYY-MM-DD for the date and HH:MM for the time.

nested_items.name: endTime
nested_items.description: The time a job will stop rollout of the job document to all devices in the target group for a job. The endTime must take place no later than two years from the current time and be scheduled a minimum of thirty minutes from the current time. The minimum duration between startTime and endTime is thirty minutes. The maximum duration between startTime and endTime is two years. The date and time format for the endTime is YYYY-MM-DD for the date and HH:MM for the time.

nested_items.name: endBehavior
nested_items.description: Specifies the end behavior for all job executions after a job reaches the selected endTime. If endTime is not selected when creating the job, then endBehavior does not apply.

nested_items.name: maintenanceWindows
nested_items.description: An optional configuration within the SchedulingConfig to setup a recurring maintenance window with a predetermined start time and duration for the rollout of a job document to all devices in a target group for a job.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: Displays the start time of the next maintenance window.

nested_items.name: durationInMinutes
nested_items.description: Displays the duration of the next maintenance window.

nested_items.name: scheduledJobRollouts
nested_items.description: Displays the next seven maintenance window occurrences and their start times.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: Displays the start times of the next seven maintenance window occurrences.

nested_items.name: destinationPackageVersions
nested_items.description: The package version Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that are installed on the device when the job successfully completes. The package version must be in either the Published or Deprecated state when the job deploys. For more information, see Package version lifecycle.The package version must be in either the Published or Deprecated state when the job deploys. For more information, see Package version lifecycle.
(string) ---
